lesson.title: Create a new Xamarin.Android project using Xamarin Studio
lesson.description: Create a new Couchbase Lite project for Xamarin.Android in Xamarin Studio

introduction.paragraph: This lesson describes how to set up the Couchbase Lite environment for Xamarin.Android using Xamarin Studio on a Mac.

body.paragraph: Before you can build an app, you need to set up your development environment:

list-item.paragraph: Download and install Xamarin. The Xamarin installer will install everything you need to develop using Xamarin.Android.
Download the Xamarin Android Player. The Xamarin Android Player provides a much faster emulator than the ones that come with the Android SDK.
Under the Xamarin Android Player's Devices section, download one (or more) of the Android device images. For this tutorial we'll be using the Nexus 5 (Lollipop) image shown below:
After the device image download completes, enter Couchbase Lite Tutorial for the device name and select New Device:
Once the device image install completes it will appear in the Installed section:
In the Welcome Page choose NewSolution.
In the New Project window, select Android > App > Android App and click Next:

In the Configure your Android app screen, enter Couchbase Events for the application name, enter an Identifier (the default is fine for the tutorial), choose Maximum Capability for the Target Platform, and leave the Theme set to Default:
On the next screen choose a location for the project and click Create.

body.paragraph: To use Couchbase-Lite in your Xamarin.Android project, you need to add the Couchbase Lite package from NuGet. You can do this using the built-in NuGet support in Xamarin Studio.

list-item.paragraph: Right-click (or Ctrl-click) the CouchbaseEvents project in the Solution Pad and select Add > Add NuGet Packages to open the Add Packages dialog.
Search for Couchbase Lite, select it from the list, and click Add Package to add Couchbase Lite along with its dependencies to the project.

body.paragraph: Running the empty app at this point verifies everying is set up correctly.

list-item.paragraph: In the Xamarin Studio tool bar, set the emulator to the Couchbase Lite Tutorial (API 21) image you created earlier in the Android Player.
Also in the Xamarin Studio tool bar, click the Run button.
This will launch the emulator, install the shared runtime, install the app, and launch it:
